thread.title: Canada: Suspect Linked To Hindu Temple Break-Ins In Canada's Greater Toronto Arrested | World News, Times Now
thread.title_full: Canada: Suspect Linked To Hindu Temple Break-Ins In Canada's Greater Toronto Arrested | World News, Times Now

author: Danita Yadav
title: Canada: Suspect Linked To Hindu Temple Break-Ins In Canada's Greater Toronto Arrested | World News, Times Now
text: Suspect Linked To Hindu Temple Break-Ins In Canada's Greater Toronto Arrested A suspect has been identified in the break-ins that occurred at Hindu Temples back in October. As per a statement by Durham Regional Police, 41-year-old Jagdish Pandher has been named as the prime suspect. Suspect Linked To Hindu Temple Attacks In Canada's Greater Toronto Arrested Photo : iStock Durham: A suspect has been identified in the break-ins that occurred at Hindu Temples back in October. As per a statement by Durham Regional Police, 41-year-old Jagdish Pandher has been named as the prime suspect. "On Sunday, October 8, 2023, at approximately 12:45 a.m., members of West Division responded to reports of a break-and-enter in progress at a Hindu temple in the area of Bayly Street and Krosno Boulevard in Pickering. A male was seen on security surveillance breaking into the temple and taking a large quantity of cash from the donation boxes. The male fled the area before police arrival. The male was seen on surveillance footage later that morning committing additional break-and-enters at Hindu temples in Pickering and Ajax," reads the official statement issued by Durham Police. As per the police, Pandher has also been linked to various other break-ins at Hindu Temples throughout the year in Durham Region and around the Greater Toronto Area. "Although these offences occurred at places of worship, they do not appear to be hate crimes or motivated by hate," the police clarified in its press release. 41-Year-Olf Jagdish Pandher from Bramptom faces numerous charges. These are - Four counts of Break-and-Enter Place Other Than Dwelling, Four counts of Possess Property Obtained by Crime Under $5000, One count of Break-and-Enter with Intent and five counts of Breach of Probation. On October 8, 2023, in the cities of Pickering and Ajax, numerous break-ins were reported at Hindu temples in the area. The suspect was spotted breaking and entering around 12:45 AM and 1:30 AM at different temples in the region. Pandher, who will now be presented for a bail hearing, has been on the run for the past three months.
